meanings.definition: A book containing examples of handwriting or exercises for practice.
meanings.sent1: In school, we used copybooks to practice our handwriting.
meanings.sent2: Students were asked to bring their copybooks to class every day.
meanings.sent3: The copybooks were so full of scribbles, they looked like art!
meanings.sent4: Her copybook was a treasure trove of memories, each page a different story.
meanings.sent5: The copybooks lay neatly stacked on the desk, waiting to be filled with practice exercises.

meanings.definition: A book containing printed examples of text for students to copy.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out copybooks with passages for us to copy.
meanings.sent2: The copybooks in the library had beautiful poems for students to practice.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally copied the wrong page from his copybook and got a funny result.
meanings.sent4: The copybook was a mirror of the original text, each word faithfully reproduced.
meanings.sent5: As she flipped through the copybook, she marveled at the neat rows of text waiting to be copied.
